title: Water System Installation
goal: Ensure reliable access to potable water for family, garden, and livestock using the borehole and solar-powered pumping system.

steps.title: Test Borehole Depth and Water Level
steps.description: Drop a weighted string down the borehole. Mark water level. Ensure pump will be submerged at least 1m below water level but 2m above bottom.

steps.title: Prepare Tank Platform
steps.description: Level ground area 3m x 3m. Mix concrete (1:3:6 ratio). Create 100mm thick slab. Let cure 24 hours minimum.

steps.title: Install Solar Panel Frame
steps.description: Mount panels facing north at 30° angle. Use treated timber frame or metal brackets. Secure against strong winds typical in Beaufort West.

steps.title: Connect Electrical System
steps.description: Wire panels in series to controller. Connect controller to pump with waterproof connections. Test voltage before connecting pump.

steps.title: Install Submersible Pump
steps.description: Attach safety rope to pump. Connect discharge pipe and electrical cable. Lower carefully into borehole. Secure cables at wellhead.

steps.title: Connect Piping to Tank
steps.description: Run 40mm pipe from borehole to tank inlet. Install float valve at tank. Add overflow pipe directing water away from tank base.

steps.title: Install Distribution System
steps.description: Connect outlet valve at tank base. Run pipes to kitchen, shower, and garden areas. Install taps at each point.

steps.title: Test and Commission
steps.description: Check all connections for leaks. Monitor pump operation for 2 hours. Adjust float valve. Document flow rate.

tips: Install a bypass valve at the pump to allow manual filling during cloudy periods using a generator if needed.
Label all pipes for future maintenance.
Keep extra fittings and pipe for emergency repairs.
safety: Always disconnect solar panels before handling electrical connections.
Wear gloves and safety glasses when handling cement or tools.
Ensure the tank stand is level and solid to prevent tipping.
